role_in_ecosystem: Industry-wide payment card fraud and breach threat intelligence coordination managed by PCI Security Standards Council and card networks
official_definition: Payment card industry threat intelligence program collecting and analyzing payment card breach data, fraud patterns, attack methods, and emerging threats; Coordinated by PCI SSC and card networks; Provides advisories, bulletins, and threat reports; Supports industry awareness and defense
primary_responsibilities: Collect payment card breach data and fraud patterns; Analyze attack methods and tactics; Identify emerging threats to payment systems; Publish security advisories and bulletins; Coordinate incident response across industry; Track threat actors and campaigns; Provide threat intelligence to payment ecosystem; Support forensic investigations; Develop threat-based security controls; Share indicators of compromise (IOCs); Coordinate with law enforcement
secondary_responsibilities: Payment fraud trend analysis; Geographic threat mapping; Attack vector identification; Threat actor profiling; Malware analysis; Vulnerability exploitation tracking; Industry benchmarking; Security best practice development; Forensic investigation support; Conference presentations; Training and awareness; Research and innovation; Regulatory coordination
information_shared: Payment breach data (anonymized); Fraud patterns and statistics; Attack methods and TTPs; Malware samples and IOCs; Compromised card data patterns (no actual card data); Security vulnerabilities exploited; Threat actor information; Geographic threat data; Industry trends; Defensive recommendations; Forensic findings; Security best practices
participation_model: Open information sharing model; Public advisories and bulletins; Industry participation; Forensic investigator contribution; Card network coordination; Merchant and processor reporting; Public and confidential channels; Research community engagement; Conference presentations; Blog posts and publications
geographic_scope: Global payment card industry; 200+ countries; Cross-border threat tracking; International payment networks; Regional threat analysis; Worldwide merchant and processor coverage; International law enforcement coordination; Global forensic investigation support
member_benefits: Access to threat intelligence bulletins; Security advisories and alerts; Breach trend analysis; Attack method information; Best practice guidance; Conference access; Training materials; Forensic guidance; Industry networking; Research findings; Regulatory insight; Early warning of emerging threats
communication_channels: PCI SSC blog and website; Email bulletins; Industry conferences; Webinars and training; Published research reports; Security alerts; Threat advisories; Direct communications to networks/acquirers; Forensic investigator network; Law enforcement liaison; Media and press releases
real_time_alerting: Real-time alerts for critical threats; Email bulletins for emerging threats; Quarterly threat summaries; Annual threat reports; Conference presentations; Ad-hoc advisories for major incidents; Immediate notification of systemic threats; Critical vulnerability announcements
incident_coordination: Incident coordination across payment industry; Forensic investigation coordination; Law enforcement liaison; Cross-industry information sharing; Breach notification coordination; Response best practices; Post-incident analysis; Systemic threat response; Industry-wide defensive measures
threat_analysis_capabilities: Payment card fraud analysis; Breach pattern recognition; Malware analysis; Attack attribution; Threat actor tracking; Vulnerability analysis; Forensic investigation data; Statistical analysis; Trend identification; Predictive threat modeling; Geographic analysis; Industry benchmarking
reporting_frequency: Quarterly threat reports; Annual industry threat analysis; Weekly or bi-weekly bulletins; Real-time critical alerts; Conference presentations; Research publications; Blog posts; Ad-hoc advisories; Monthly summaries (informal); Continuous online updates
membership_requirements: Open access to public information; Forensic investigators contribute detailed findings; Card networks provide network data; Merchants and processors report incidents; Voluntary participation for detailed intelligence; Confidential reporting channels; Industry membership (PCI SSC participating organizations); Law enforcement coordination
